website_summaries.verdict: An affordable, easy-to-use heart rate monitor that offers plenty of helpful feedback. The best bargain for the lowest price.
pros: Will count calories and store last 10 readings
cons: Occasional loss of signal between wrist and chest unit

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working after 2 uses in 2 weeks.  Garbage!
customer_reviews.text: Stopped working after 2 uses in 2 weeks. Remember the Polar chest-straps that were one nice piece of rugged plastic with the sensor built-in? This is NOT one of them. The wrist unit suddenly receives no heartbeat info from the chest-strap. Changed the chest-strap battery - still NG. 2 weeks, no abuse, no water on either unit - nothing. Will return. Probably will get something else. Totally disappointing. Update: Returned via Kohl's on 1/21. As of 1/28, Amazon hasn't seen it, and Kohl's can't tell me how to track it. Kohl's says it's still in a trailer on their dock, waiting for a truck. Very frustrating. Will not return anything via Kohl's again.
customer_reviews.author: bobn

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use. Even swimming.
customer_reviews.text: This is exactly what I wanted. An easy to use monitor that I can use rowing, biking, hiking, swimming. I just wanted to see the heart rate. It does more: calories, fat burning, zone times. And you can upload info to Polar web-site if you wish. All that is a plus. But my main purpose was to see HR in any activity I'm doing. And this fits the bill perfectly. Even the chest strap is more comfortable than older model I had many years ago. Also adjust small enough for me, female.
customer_reviews.author: M

customer_reviews.title: Heart rate doesnt works.
customer_reviews.text: Dont buy. I dont know why but the heart rate monitor doesnt works. I bought it twice because i dont like giving bad reviews. Both same problem: money down the drain! I have been using Polar watches since 2007 so i know exactly hoy to use them. Last two i got it is just a continuous struggle with the heart rate monitor doesnt matter if strap is soakly wet, mildly wet or completelt dry. It just doesnt works. I changes both batteries: watch and strap to find out if this was the problem and it wasnt.
customer_reviews.author: Laura B.

customer_reviews.title: Not user friendly and eats batteries
customer_reviews.text: This thing is not user friendly. I was looking for a basic pulse rate monitor. Every time you use it you need to do a "button dance" to get it in that mode. Press this button ... then that button ... then press this button twice, ... then press this button again .... etc. Plus, I have had it for just about 10 months, use it maybe three hours a week, and the battery in the watch portion needs to be replaced. Not a good item.
customer_reviews.author: Dave S.

customer_reviews.title: UNRELIABLE PRODUCT
customer_reviews.text: POLAR FT7 STARTED TO BE A TRUSTWORTHY UNIT IN THE BEGINNING. THE UNIT DUPLICATED EXACTLY WHAT WAS ON THE EXERCISE MACHINES AT MY GYM. THEN AFTER AWHILE ALL OF MY 3 UNITS WERE THE SAME. CHANGED THE BATTERY SEVERAL TIMES BUT WAS NOT TRUSTWORTHY. THEY ALL ACTED THE SAME AFTER A CERTAIN TIME PERIOD. JUST WALKING IN FROM THE PARKING LOT THRU THE LOBBY OF THE GYM TO THE FIRST MACHINE I BURNED 20 CALORIES???????? JUST ANOTHER PRODUCT MADE IN CHINA FOR AMERICAN CONSUMPTION.
customer_reviews.author: Edward Greene

customer_reviews.title: Very Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I owned a Polar HRM for 13 years and it worked perfectly! It finally gave out and I purchased this one. From day one, it never worked accurately! I position the strap/electrodes properly against my skin and it works for a minute, then disconnects! I wish I returned it when I first experienced the issue but wanted it to work as I am so loyal to the brand!
customer_reviews.author: Cat Lover

customer_reviews.title: Verify the size of your wrist before ordering this monitor
customer_reviews.text: I was excited about this heart monitor as I am need of an exercise program and the wanted to use my heart rate to determine the proper level to burn fat before I went into the aerobic level. Unfortunately the monitor was small and even though I ordered an extra large wrist band it was way too small for my wrist. This would cause problems for my already injury plagued wrist. I returned it and was promptly given a refund. The monitor was also so small that it was fairly hard to read to begin with
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight and accurate
customer_reviews.text: Accurate, lightweight, easy to use, barely know it's on while wearing it. It's a bit tough to read without my reading glasses on, but I ain't no spring chicken anymore. It does what I want well; heart rate, calorie brun, duration. For me it makes no sense to buy a two hundred dollar tracker that's not as accurate and has silly functions I would never use. This is an easy to use straightforward simple accurate monitor.
customer_reviews.author: jz

customer_reviews.title: Waste of Money in this age of blue tooth technology
customer_reviews.text: I knew that it was not a blue tooth device when I purchased it. My primary reason was to use it in the pool. But it is so difficult to use I put it in my junk pile.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I use the when I'm at CrossFit. It doesn't ...
customer_reviews.text: I use the when I'm at CrossFit. It doesn't get in the way of any movements, I sometimes just push it a little further up my wrist. I did try to take it off once and set it on the floor next to me but it wouldn't read my heart rate. The chest strap doesn't bother me. One time when I was rowing, I kept hitting the sensor hard and it fell off, that's on me though. It keeps up well with the spikes and falls that come with doing CrossFit. I got it to help monitor my heart rate during pregnancy.
customer_reviews.author: Andrea

customer_reviews.title: Good, but died :(
customer_reviews.text: Polar. If you are reading this can you send me a new watch? I have tried to replace the battery and it is still not working. I love this watch! I feel like it is a very accurate due to wearing the heart rate monitor band. I j
customer_reviews.author: Alexis Smith

customer_reviews.title: HRM stops working randomly.
customer_reviews.text: When it works, it's great. But the HR monitor randomly stops working, and I can't determine why. I've only had it a couple months. Polar offers not- helpful advice like "check the batteries", and "Make sure you clean it after each use". Yeah, both go without saying. Maybe my unit is defective. I will certainly NEVER buy Polar again, and I can't recommend it to others. Maybe it's something else, like does it work less well when you sweat profusely? If so, Polar should mention that when you contact them. I've read other owners have had the same problem. I'm going to send mine back, and ask for a refund.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie Clayton

customer_reviews.title: Its ok but probably will return
customer_reviews.text: Just got my FT7 two days ago. I only bought it for the heart rate monitor feature and seems to work well. The main issue I have is the buttons on the watch are very small and at time, difficult to press which makes the menu selection / scrolling harder than it should be. The watch face is small and makes reading the info harder as well. Probably will return for another type.
customer_reviews.author: BJR

customer_reviews.title: Works great for a few months, then . . .
customer_reviews.text: This heart rate monitor worked perfectly for about three months. I was very happy with it. Then it started failing in the middle of my workouts, giving me an “unable to detect” heartbeat message. I have tried everything from changing the batteries to adjusting the strap, moving its position, moistening the sensors . . . it works for a while and then stops. This is very frustrating and very unfortunate that a produce that worked so well started failing after only a few months of use. Based on my experience I would not recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Mikel

customer_reviews.title: Simple accesory to acquire
customer_reviews.text: Great watch. I like the calorie counter, timer, heart beat monitor and record tracking. It is a simple fundamental tool to keep you informed about your accomplishments after every workout. It keeps me inspired to maintain a level of consistency or go above and beyond. It is not that fancy, but it does enough. Fitness is a lifestyle. This watch isn't a fitness lifestyle (bells and whistles) in itself but it compliments one.
customer_reviews.author: 1sttimedon

customer_reviews.title: Good if it works, shame it doesn't
customer_reviews.text: The heart rate monitor worked properly for about 4-5 times. Then the readings where erratic, all over the place. I replaced the battery and the problem was still there. Eventually I gave up and stopped using it. Very nice if it would work, but it doesn't on the long run. Shame
customer_reviews.author: Mik

customer_reviews.title: best customer service ever
customer_reviews.text: I bought this watch for calorie counting and it didn't work the right way. First, I used it while walking for 52 minutes at a normal pace and supposedly I burnt around 500 calories, which it's too much. Then, I used it for a Pilates and zumba class, and I  ̈burnt" around 1000 calories with two hours of exercise, way too much again. This watch is not accurate at all, so DON'T BUY it if you are interesting on that. I have a friend that bougth the ft4, and it's more accurate than this model. Amazon gave me a full refund for this watch, best customer service ever!
customer_reviews.author: Katherine Cabral

customer_reviews.title: Don't believe them
customer_reviews.text: It's impossible to transfer data now from the FT7 to Polar Flow, the company's new service. So you can buy this watch and the sync device, but it won't sync properly or at all. Several calls to customer service were unsatisfactory. Buy a watch from another company.
customer_reviews.author: Will

customer_reviews.title: Very good monitor. I have used it for about two ...
customer_reviews.text: Very good monitor. I have used it for about two years now when i work hard and while using my treadmill . Very helpful to me to understand the stress my heart is under whil doing different types of exercise .
customer_reviews.author: SID

customer_reviews.title: Very accurate.
customer_reviews.text: I have used a polar heart rate monitor for 15 years and they make a great product. My old one finally stopped giving accurate results. Pros. Heart rate and calories very accurate during cardio where my Fitbit is all over the place. The chest strap is much improved over the older model. Cons. My favorite feature of the old watch was to see exercise duration and heart rate at the same time. This is no longer available. It's harder to push the buttons on the new model.
customer_reviews.author: JohnE

customer_reviews.title: ... (1 for myself and 2 as gifts) because I love them so much
customer_reviews.text: I've purchased 3 of these Polar FT7 watches (1 for myself and 2 as gifts) because I love them so much. It's great for me to be able to accurately keep track of my heart rate during exercise and to see my calories burned. This watch is also very comfortable and I almost always wear it whether or not I'm using it. I was pleasantly surprised at the comfort of the chest strap and find even in my 4+ hour training sessions I forget I'm wearing it. I absolutely recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Anneliese K

customer_reviews.title: I really loved the watch while it worked
customer_reviews.text: I really loved the watch while it worked. For the price, I was expecting it to last longer. Mine only lasted about 2 years. I put new batteries in the chest strap and watch thinking that was the problem, but it will will not hold a connection. You enter your personal info and this watch uses your HR to track calories burned, tracks your time, and many other really cool options. Just wish it worked longer than 2 years. I'm not sure if there's a warranty, I lost the paperwork to it when I moved!
customer_reviews.author: Erin Ross

customer_reviews.title: Works well, but alarm inaudible.
customer_reviews.text: I ended up returning this. I wanted to use it to keep my HR under a defined limit. Unfortunately, the audible alarm is VERY quiet, so I couldn't hear it on a normal cycle ride. Because it is wrist-mounted it is not possible to monitor HR without constantly removing my hand from the handlebar.
customer_reviews.author: Peter W. Fraser

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: I love this. I am trying to lose weight for my wedding and it is very helpful to find out exactly how many calories I am burning during my workouts. I find this to be a great motivator to try harder in order to burn extra.
customer_reviews.author: LLara

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: Really like this product. Doctors orders included exercise for an amount of time at a particular heart rate ... and it's so fun to accomplish with the Polar FT7... I'm motivated and can see my goal accomplished every day while I'm out walking. I didn't need all the high tech apps and all that other products offer... this perfectly fits my needs.
customer_reviews.author: kaps

customer_reviews.title: Chest strap connection loop is prone to disconnect
customer_reviews.text: Chest strap was prone to falling off me. The fastner is sub par. Today it got lost. Also, need to have a display that shows HR and event time on the same screen.
customer_reviews.author: Iris H

customer_reviews.title: I am not at all disappointed. I got this about a month ago
customer_reviews.text: I mainly bought this to get an accurate reading of my heart rate during exercises.I am not at all disappointed. I got this about a month ago. The strap is lot better than it used to be with previous models. As the elasticity decreases over time, you can keep adjusting the strap to fit your chest. Also, the sensor is removable from the strap. The monitor/the watch in the model has more functions than previous models.The calorie count seems to be on the high side. If I can only expend that many calories, I will be elated! Finally, with this model, I can replace the battery both in the sensor and monitor! What a feature!
customer_reviews.author: B Dasarathy

customer_reviews.title: Good. Make sure you check out other options from Polar first though.
customer_reviews.text: This works fine for my needs, accurate and great price. Less one star because I didn't know the chest strap was adjustable M- XL which is still a bit big on the smallest it will go. Also I would say check out the other bands Polar has to offer before you buy like the Loop or A360, more expensive but they are also activity trackers. This only measures heart rate with the chest strap and tells pretty accurate calories burnt.
customer_reviews.author: Rjoyw

customer_reviews.title: Please contact me about this product
customer_reviews.text: I am trying to get a refund on this item, I do not have the box that it came in since I never expected it to stop working within weeks of purchase. This is the second one I purchased in 6 months that stopped working. I thought the last one was a fluke bc I've owned this model before
customer_reviews.author: Jenna

customer_reviews.title: Poor user interface.  Records the wrong type of data.
customer_reviews.text: The numbers and letters on the dial are too small. It records data I don't care about, but doesn't record lap times.
customer_reviews.author: Engineer

customer_reviews.title: Works as Advertised
customer_reviews.text: Only negative is that the text on the display screen are too small, much smaller that previous heart rate monitors that I've purchased from Polar. Quick shipping a bonus, highly recommended, AAA+++
customer_reviews.author: George Cataulin

customer_reviews.title: Works with Issues
customer_reviews.text: This heart rate monitor does work but has 2 issues. First it is hard to read. Second the clip to attach the chest strap consists of a male plastic hook and a female piece of cloth sleeve, very cheap.
customer_reviews.author: Lulick

customer_reviews.title: I like it so far. Does everything I need and works well.
customer_reviews.text: I had an older gen polar hr monitor in the past that I loved. Bought this one and same story so far. Pretty cheap compared to the ones that don't use a chest strap but the chest strap provides the most accurate reading from what I have read. Keeps a ton of workout logs and works automatically with all of the equipment at my gym so that it displays in front of me as well as on the watch. The chest strap is comfortable to the point I forget that I am wearing it. Overall very happy with the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy jay

customer_reviews.title: Broke immediately
customer_reviews.text: If I could give this heart rate monitor zero stars I would. Save your money! Do not buy this heart rate monitor! I have been using polar heart rate monitors for 8 years now and this is the first one that has been a complete disappointment. Like other reviews, mine worked at first and then after about 8 weeks it just stopped reading the heart rate and would freeze or jump from 56 to 260 mid work out. It is very frustrating to spend $100.00 on something that doesn’t work and cannot be returned.
customer_reviews.author: Courtney

customer_reviews.title: Delighted with the purchase.
customer_reviews.text: I am delighted with the Polar ft-7. It is just what I wanted. I don't have a smartphone to pair with a fit bit, but this does the trick. I especially like that it pairs with the Spin equipment at the Y so I can monitor heart rate on the panel instead of having to look at the watch. Also pairs easily with the Flowlink to put the data on the site.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: ... able to track what you're burning more accurately is awesome. Works great
customer_reviews.text: Being able to track what you're burning more accurately is awesome. Works great, I mostly use it for basketball. Only issue I run into is after a while the chest strap starts to slip down my chest, so if you're planning on using it for anything where you will be jumping a lot be aware you will need to adjust it here and there.
customer_reviews.author: Travis

customer_reviews.title: Great disappointment. I have bought other refurbished items from ...
customer_reviews.text: I got this refurbished item. It didn't work. I even bought new batteries, and it still didn't work. Returning. Great disappointment. I have bought other refurbished items from Amazon with success.
customer_reviews.author: Rob in DC

customer_reviews.title: Not reliable
customer_reviews.text: Did a great job for about 10 days and then it sort of quit, always showing a HR of 58-60 even I as up to 90-100. I washed the chest strap and made it was tight but it still did not work. A pity as the HR numbers are easy to read. I returned it to Amazon
customer_reviews.author: Nick

customer_reviews.title: Great product.  Accurate. Easy to use.
customer_reviews.text: My son carefully researched this product and is thrilled by its performance. He uses it with the chest monitor. Compared to FitBit and Apple Watch, HR monitoring is precisely accurate at high HR (I know fault of other products). I would recommend praticularly for anyone who wants to accurately tract their performance.
customer_reviews.author: LoveMailOrder

customer_reviews.title: Junk
customer_reviews.text: It works fairly well, but it eats batteries like candy. The manufacturer's claims about battery life are grossly overstated; I have replaced batteries twice since I bought it just a very few months ago. This is updated - today is July 1 - barely over three months and the blasted thing has died - this is ridiculous. A complete waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: lchance

customer_reviews.title: Happy healthy heart
customer_reviews.text: This is my first heart rate monitor and I highly recommend it. I can now keep track of of conditioned my heart is getting and how many calories I am burning. The only negative I have about it is that I am very small (size 0-2) and the strap that goes around your chest only adjust so far. I have to wear a sports bra with a tight band to hold the monitor strap on securely.
customer_reviews.author: Becky boo

customer_reviews.title: Great product, great price!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace a Polar heart rate monitor I have had for almost 10 years and I really like the FT7!! It gives me valuable workout information, the chest strap is pretty comfortable and I can change both batteries myself. Very happy with this product.
customer_reviews.author: Ann Marie

customer_reviews.title: This is a great watch with the only exception is the band which ...
customer_reviews.text: This is a great watch with the only exception is the band which lasts for only about 2 years. I have been unable to get another band so I end up having to buy a new watch.
customer_reviews.author: M Selah

customer_reviews.title: Works fine, just like the description says
customer_reviews.text: Works fine, just like the description says. Not five stars because the screen is not as clear as my normal digital watch and the screen text font is too small to read in less than bright light. Also, screen light is weak. Included instructions are incomplete. User must go to polar website for complete instructions.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Second one to quit on me within a year
customer_reviews.text: And now I give up. It never worked consistently, and less than a year after purchase this, my second one, quit as well. I won't be fooled a third time.
customer_reviews.author: Florida Dave

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: Works great. Easy to use. Comfortable chest strap - don't even notice it is on! The heart rate monitor seems to automatically sync with the cardio machines at the gym so the HR number displayed on the machine is the one from my chest strap - cool feature. This means that I can set my watch to calorie count while still keeping an eye on my heart rate. This is my first heart rate monitor and I love it. Workouts go by faster with all this info to focus on. I even find myself working harder to make sure I meet/exceed the previous day's numbers. Would totally buy this again.
customer_reviews.author: BitserPDX

customer_reviews.title: Heart rate and stop watch
customer_reviews.text: Gives me great satisfaction to give it one star. Any serious athlete would want heart rate and stopwatch on the same screen. Astonishingly, this is not possible.
customer_reviews.author: Ahi90

customer_reviews.title: Fair for Beginners just starting a Walking program
customer_reviews.text: Okay, buttons on watch small and difficult to set. Heart monitor moves if you do anything other than fast walk. Don't sweat too much either or it slips out of place. For the money, fine for beginners.
customer_reviews.author: S. Leibert

customer_reviews.title: I love being able to track calorie burn and heart rate
customer_reviews.text: I have used this almost every day for three weeks. I love being able to track calorie burn and heart rate. I also love the synopsis that they give you once your workout is complete.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie Leonard

customer_reviews.title: What I like the most its heart rate accuracy
customer_reviews.text: What I like the most its heart rate accuracy, compared numbers with my Walgreens HR monitors and they are spot on. What I don't like. characters are very small, backlight is dim so it is not readable at night (by me, I use prescription glasses)
customer_reviews.author: Luis H. Velasquez

customer_reviews.title: Would not buy again.
customer_reviews.text: To begin with I really liked this monitor. However, within in 6 months the heart rate monitor stopped sending or the watch stopped receiving. Changed batteries, turned off and on, nothing helped. Since the heart rate monitor was the most important feature to me, I tossed it in the garbage and bought a different brand.
customer_reviews.author: Fred

customer_reviews.title: I love it! Plus
customer_reviews.text: I had a pink one & it disappeared. I got this one for my birthday recently. I love it! Plus, when I put all of my personal info in, it recognized it was my birthday & had a little cake with candles on one of the screens all day!! It was a nice little unexpected touch!
customer_reviews.author: Cashley

customer_reviews.title: Inaccurate heart rate monitor
customer_reviews.text: Do not like this heart rate monitor at all. Several years ago, i had an Polar FT4 and loved it. This one does not get an accurate heart rate or calorie count. Very annoying. Heart rate is all over the place.
customer_reviews.author: LA Hall

customer_reviews.title: Almost perfect but not quite
customer_reviews.text: Had this watch for a little over a year. Really like it a lot but was frustrated and very disappointed when the nite light stopped working so quickly.
customer_reviews.author: R. Cook

customer_reviews.title: Ok
customer_reviews.text: Works great but I’m not a watch wearing person so I exchanged this for the Bluetooth strap.
customer_reviews.author: inna

customer_reviews.title: Overall good product.
customer_reviews.text: 95% of the time is works exactly as expected. 5% is goes haywire. I'm fairly certain it does this when someone else with a heart rate monitor is nearby. I have not been able to prove this theory. Getting it very sweaty does not affect its ability to function properly. Overall good product.
customer_reviews.author: Mr+Mrs Young

customer_reviews.title: Foul Odor, Foul Customer Service
customer_reviews.text: I have had the FT7 for about two months. This product functions well as a HRM but the SoftStrap has an awful chemical odor from the sealant that bonds the contacts to the strap. Polar has sent two replacement straps. They have the same odor. Their service rep. would provide no other remedy, "unlikely that all three straps were defective, insinuated improper cleaning of the strap, recommended buying a ProStrap" to fix their product issue. Sad.
customer_reviews.author: John B. McNabb

customer_reviews.title: Like the watch
customer_reviews.text: Like the watch. It's a little smaller than I thought I'd be, but still ok for a man (I hope). Also wish the backlight was brighter. Still, for a sports watch with all its funtions at $70, very pleased.
customer_reviews.author: Jason M.

customer_reviews.title: Worked fine for a month and started having issues for the ...
customer_reviews.text: Had this for a little over a year. Stopped working and says check heart rate transmitter. Changed batteries on both the watch and chest strap a month ago. Worked fine for a month and started having issues for the last month.
customer_reviews.author: A. Radi

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: You can read my full review here on my blog:  I love this watch! I was looking for a watch to track my fitness but also had a normal "watch" look to it. Even when I don't wear my heart rate monitor (which I barely notice is on), I am always wearing this watch! I bought the purple band.
customer_reviews.author: Marisa

customer_reviews.title: Heart rate monitor
customer_reviews.text: I use it for my heart rate when I am on the eliptical machine for cardio-vascular workout. It seems to work very well using it for about a month. It calculates a much lower calorie burn than the machine does. I have no way of knowing which, or if either, is closer to being accurate on the calorie burn.
customer_reviews.author: Lowell Headley

customer_reviews.title: Died after 6 months
customer_reviews.text: It worked fairly well, but it died after 6 months of normal use. The buttons do not work, and the screen cycles through. The heart monitor won't even connect. This is the second Polar watch I've had that did this.
customer_reviews.author: Biochemlady

customer_reviews.title: Great heart rate monitor
customer_reviews.text: Wear everytime I exercise, easy to use and I think accurate
customer_reviews.author: Kelly

customer_reviews.title: It works just fine for an older person trying to get/stay in shape ...
customer_reviews.text: This is my second one. The first was used for years till the band got brittle and broke. It works just fine for an older person trying to get/stay in shape without overdoing it. The warning beeper on it is worthless though, simply not loud enough to hear when you are moving.
customer_reviews.author: Sunny

customer_reviews.title: Just what i wanted
customer_reviews.text: Works great, low cost, accurate, I am replacing a 3 year old polar that also worked great. I never take it off so it takes a beating, water, cold, hot, banging around. I'd recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Wedge

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use, fast response time
customer_reviews.text: Wanted a simple to use, accurate pulse rate monitor that responds quickly. This fit the bill. Very pleased!
customer_reviews.author: Steven Snyder

customer_reviews.title: Great incentive to work out harder
customer_reviews.text: Great incentive to work out harder!! I use this with the chest strap that it came with, I feel that it is accurate and i like that i can just rinse the strap. I just wish it would link up with an app.
customer_reviews.author: AlmaH

customer_reviews.title: I didn't work!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Three days after getting the ft7 it quit working. I returned it.
customer_reviews.author: CC

customer_reviews.title: This is the third heart monitor I have owned my ...
customer_reviews.text: This is the third heart monitor I have owned my favored for workouts at club. It provides the features I need in a clean format.
customer_reviews.author: LEMN

customer_reviews.title: Not as good as other Polars
customer_reviews.text: Im a fan of Polar heat rate monitors... bu this model doesn’t work as well as others. It takes too long to register that it is strapp d in compared to other models. I remember this from before when I accidentally bought his model... and I accidentally bought it again. My recommendation is to never buy this model.
customer_reviews.author: Greg Carver

customer_reviews.title: Piece of crap. Maybe time to retire this model
customer_reviews.text: Doesn't last. Malfunctioned after 3 months; returned for a new one; that one lasted 5 months before conking out. Piece of crap. Maybe time to retire this model??
customer_reviews.author: ACF1

customer_reviews.title: Love this watch and heart rate monitor
customer_reviews.text: Love this watch and heart rate monitor. Does its job and perfect for the price. I got the black one. Chest strap is adjustable.
customer_reviews.author: Taz

customer_reviews.title: Worked very consistently when I first got it. However ...
customer_reviews.text: Worked very consistently when I first got it. However, now every time I use it the reading is iratic. During each work out most of the time it measures accurately. But it also gives false high readings in the mid to high 200's and also some readings of zero every time I use it.
customer_reviews.author: Don S.

customer_reviews.title: Very accurate
customer_reviews.text: Use this every day, heart rate within a few beats, many times exact match to Nonin Medical grade pulse oximeter.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Zeiler

customer_reviews.title: worked about 5 times, then broke

Energy Pointer feature tells you if the main effect of your training is fitness improvement or fat burning
Smart Calorie feature uses your personal data to provide accurate calories burned
Includes heart rate chest strap made of soft fabric material that adapts to your body shape; Requires and includes chest strap for accurate heart rate
Connects with compatible gym equipment using Gym Link and water resistant (30m)
